20110114230215.000|20110114230217.000|TR0|Loughner was a man in motion.  Loughner

20110114230243.000|20110114230245.000|TR0|recorded the door to Loughner's room 
20110114230245.000|20110114230247.000|TR0|opening and closing, opening and closing

20110114230301.000|20110114230304.000|TR0|friends."

20110114230311.000|20110114230313.000|TR0|November, but needs ammo.  A clerk at this

20110114230318.000|20110114230320.000|TR0|he wants.

20110114230329.000|20110114230332.000|TR0|game and fish officer.  He gets off with a

20110114230339.000|20110114230341.000|TR0|and won't tell his dad what is up.  The 
20110114230341.000|20110114230343.000|TR0|22-year-old leaves his car behind and 
20110114230343.000|20110114230346.000|TR0|takes off on foot with the black bag.  His 
20110114230346.000|20110114230348.000|TR0|dad follows in his truck, but can't find 
20110114230348.000|20110114230350.000|TR0|him.  Over the next two hours, police 
20110114230350.000|20110114230353.000|TR0|believe Loughner drops off the black bag 
20110114230353.000|20110114230355.000|TR0|in a dry riverbed.  It's later found with 
20110114230355.000|20110114230357.000|TR0|seven boxes of .9- millimeter ammo and a 
20110114230357.000|20110114230400.000|TR0|receipt for the bag.
20110114230400.000|20110114230402.000|TR0|
20110114230402.000|20110114230404.000|TR0|At about 9:40, a cab driver picks up 
20110114230404.000|20110114230407.000|TR0|Loughner at this convenience store and 
20110114230407.000|20110114230409.000|TR0|drives him about six miles to the Safeway. 
20110114230409.000|20110114230411.000|TR0| Fourteen minutes later, Loughner's cab 
20110114230411.000|20110114230414.000|TR0|driver goes into the store to get change.  
20110114230414.000|20110114230416.000|TR0|At 10:10, police say Loughner fires his 
20110114230416.000|20110114230418.000|TR0|first shot.

20110114230629.000|20110114230631.000|TR0|right now, including some stunning claims 
20110114230631.000|20110114230634.000|TR0|about Ronald Reagan coming from his 
20110114230634.000|20110114230636.000|TR0|youngest son just weeks before the 
20110114230636.000|20110114230638.000|TR0|centennial of the late president's birth.
20110114230638.000|20110114230641.000|TR0|
20110114230641.000|20110114230643.000|TR0|Ron Reagan, the son, is out with a new 
20110114230643.000|20110114230645.000|TR0|book suggesting his father suffered from 
20110114230645.000|20110114230648.000|TR0|Alzheimer's disease while he was still in 
20110114230648.000|20110114230650.000|TR0|office in the White house.
20110114230650.000|20110114230652.000|TR0|
20110114230652.000|20110114230655.000|TR0|CNN's Mary Snow has been looking into this 
20110114230655.000|20110114230657.000|TR0|for us.
20110114230657.000|20110114230659.000|TR0|
20110114230659.000|20110114230702.000|TR0|Mary, what are you finding out?
20110114230702.000|20110114230704.000|TR0|
20110114230704.000|20110114230706.000|TR0|MARY SNOW, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Well, Wolf, 
20110114230706.000|20110114230709.000|TR0|President Reagan disclosed that he had 
20110114230709.000|20110114230711.000|TR0|Alzheimer's disease back in 1994.  That 
20110114230711.000|20110114230713.000|TR0|was five years after he left the White 
20110114230713.000|20110114230716.000|TR0|House.  And doctors have said that he did 
20110114230716.000|20110114230718.000|TR0|not develop the disease until he was out 
20110114230718.000|20110114230720.000|TR0|of office.
20110114230720.000|20110114230723.000|TR0|
20110114230723.000|20110114230725.000|TR0|But in his new book, Ronald Reagan Jr. 
20110114230725.000|20110114230727.000|TR0|writes about changes he noticed in his 
20110114230727.000|20110114230730.000|TR0|father as early as 1984, saying, "Three 
20110114230730.000|20110114230732.000|TR0|years into his first term as president, I 
20110114230732.000|20110114230734.000|TR0|was feeling the first shivers of concern 
20110114230734.000|20110114230737.000|TR0|that something beyond mellowing was 
20110114230737.000|20110114230739.000|TR0|affecting my father."
20110114230739.000|20110114230741.000|TR0|
20110114230741.000|20110114230744.000|TR0|He references President Reagan's poor 
20110114230744.000|20110114230746.000|TR0|performance during his first debate with 
20110114230746.000|20110114230748.000|TR0|Democratic presidential nominee Walter 
20110114230748.000|20110114230751.000|TR0|Mondale in 1984.  Reagan Jr. writes: 
20110114230751.000|20110114230753.000|TR0|"Watching the first of his two debates 
20110114230753.000|20110114230755.000|TR0|with 1984 Democratic presidential nominee 
20110114230755.000|20110114230758.000|TR0|Walter Mondale, I began to experience the 
20110114230758.000|20110114230800.000|TR0|nausea of a bad dream coming true.  My 
20110114230800.000|20110114230802.000|TR0|heart sank as he floundered his way 
20110114230802.000|20110114230805.000|TR0|through his responses, fumbling with his 
20110114230805.000|20110114230807.000|TR0|notes, uncharacteristically lost for 
20110114230807.000|20110114230809.000|TR0|words.  He looking tired and bewildered."
20110114230809.000|20110114230812.000|TR0|
20110114230812.000|20110114230814.000|TR0|He goes on to say: "I have seen no 
20110114230814.000|20110114230816.000|TR0|evidence that my father or anyone else was 
20110114230816.000|20110114230819.000|TR0|aware of his medical condition while he 
20110114230819.000|20110114230821.000|TR0|was in office. Had the diagnosis have been 
20110114230821.000|20110114230823.000|TR0|made in, say, 1987, would he have stepped 
20110114230823.000|20110114230826.000|TR0|down?  I believe he would have.  Far less 
20110114230826.000|20110114230828.000|TR0|was known about the disease then of course 
20110114230828.000|20110114230830.000|TR0|than is known now."
20110114230830.000|20110114230833.000|TR0|
20110114230833.000|20110114230835.000|TR0|Now, President Reagan's doctors have said 
20110114230835.000|20110114230837.000|TR0|that Mr. Reagan did not begin to show 
20110114230837.000|20110114230840.000|TR0|evidence of the disease until 1993.  Four 
20110114230840.000|20110114230842.000|TR0|of his White House doctors told "The New 
20110114230842.000|20110114230844.000|TR0|York Times" back in 1997 that he was 
20110114230844.000|20110114230847.000|TR0|mentally sound in office.  And they said, 
20110114230847.000|20110114230849.000|TR0|while they would not usually speak 
20110114230849.000|20110114230851.000|TR0|publicly about the former president's 
20110114230851.000|20110114230854.000|TR0|medical history, they did, because they 
20110114230854.000|20110114230856.000|TR0|said they didn't cover up any illness.  
20110114230856.000|20110114230858.000|TR0|And neither did Mr. Reagan.
20110114230858.000|20110114230901.000|TR0|
20110114230901.000|20110114230903.000|TR0|Now, some who served in the Reagan 
20110114230903.000|20110114230905.000|TR0|administration are dismissing these new 
20110114230905.000|20110114230908.000|TR0|claims by Ronald Reagan Jr.  Kenneth 
20110114230908.000|20110114230910.000|TR0|Duberstein, who served as Reagan's chief 
20110114230910.000|20110114230912.000|TR0|of staff at the end of his second term, 
20110114230912.000|20110114230915.000|TR0|told CNN's John King: "I think Ron these 
20110114230915.000|20110114230917.000|TR0|days is mostly in the business of trying 
20110114230917.000|20110114230919.000|TR0|to sell books.  That's I think.  Day in, 
20110114230919.000|20110114230922.000|TR0|day out, from the beginning to end, he was 
20110114230922.000|20110114230924.000|TR0|in command.  He was fully in command."
20110114230924.000|20110114230926.000|TR0|
20110114230926.000|20110114230929.000|TR0|And Bill Bennett, a CNN contributor who 
20110114230929.000|20110114230931.000|TR0|served as education secretary under 
20110114230931.000|20110114230933.000|TR0|President Reagan, says, "In all my 
20110114230933.000|20110114230936.000|TR0|interactions with the president, I never 
20110114230936.000|20110114230938.000|TR0|witnessed anything in him to give concern."
20110114230938.000|20110114230940.000|TR0|

20110114230943.000|20110114230945.000|TR0|next week.

20110114230957.000|20110114230959.000|TR0|was an adviser to four U.S. presidents, 
20110114230959.000|20110114231001.000|TR0|including Ronald Reagan.

20110114231008.000|20110114231010.000|TR0|
20110114231010.000|20110114231013.000|TR0|DAVID GERGEN, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL 
20110114231013.000|20110114231015.000|TR0|ANALYST:  Well, I'm sure Ron has written a 
20110114231015.000|20110114231017.000|TR0|good book.  I look forward to reading it.  
20110114231017.000|20110114231020.000|TR0|But I am surprised he has revived these 
20110114231020.000|20110114231022.000|TR0|claims.
20110114231022.000|20110114231024.000|TR0|
20110114231024.000|20110114231027.000|TR0|They have been dismissed by so many 
20110114231027.000|20110114231029.000|TR0|doctors, people who worked with him.  
20110114231029.000|20110114231031.000|TR0|Howard Baker also came in during those 
20110114231031.000|20110114231034.000|TR0|last years, came in concerned that he 
20110114231034.000|20110114231036.000|TR0|might be -- he had heard rumors that the 
20110114231036.000|20110114231038.000|TR0|president was slipping, but came out and 
20110114231038.000|20110114231041.000|TR0|said, I found him just as vital as ever.
20110114231041.000|20110114231043.000|TR0|
20110114231043.000|20110114231045.000|TR0|What I do think is that there is a -- it 
20110114231045.000|20110114231048.000|TR0|has been my understanding for some time 
20110114231048.000|20110114231050.000|TR0|that there was a panel of outside doctors 
20110114231050.000|20110114231052.000|TR0|whom examined his medical records after he 
20110114231052.000|20110114231055.000|TR0|left office and came to the conclusion 
20110114231055.000|20110114231057.000|TR0|that, yes, age was catching up to him.  He 
20110114231057.000|20110114231059.000|TR0|was a man in his 70s and he showed signs 
20110114231059.000|20110114231102.000|TR0|of age, but he did not have Alzheimer's.  
20110114231102.000|20110114231104.000|TR0|And there is a difference.  He was not 
20110114231104.000|20110114231106.000|TR0|afflicted.

20110114233231.000|20110114233234.000|TR0|and how relatively easily one can get 
20110114233234.000|20110114233236.000|TR0|one's hands on a firearm here in the 
20110114233236.000|20110114233238.000|TR0|United States.  CNN's Atika Shubert start 
20110114233238.000|20110114233241.000|TR0|us off in London.
20110114233241.000|20110114233243.000|TR0|
20110114233243.000|20110114233245.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20110114233245.000|20110114233248.000|TR0|
20110114233248.000|20110114233250.000|TR0|ATIKA SHUBERT, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, 
20110114233250.000|20110114233252.000|TR0|here on the streets of London people read 
20110114233252.000|20110114233255.000|TR0|about the shooting in Arizona with one 
20110114233255.000|20110114233257.000|TR0|question in mind: why is it so much easier 
20110114233257.000|20110114233259.000|TR0|to buy a gun in the United States?
20110114233259.000|20110114233302.000|TR0|
20110114233302.000|20110114233304.000|TR0|Here in Britain, it is illegal to buy it 
20110114233304.000|20110114233306.000|TR0|over the Internet and must be done 
20110114233306.000|20110114233309.000|TR0|face-to-face.  And it is possible to buy a 
20110114233309.000|20110114233311.000|TR0|hunting rifle if you are a member of a gun 
20110114233311.000|20110114233313.000|TR0|club, but even then you need a firearms 
20110114233313.000|20110114233316.000|TR0|certificate from the local police, and 
20110114233316.000|20110114233318.000|TR0|they need to know how you're going to use 
20110114233318.000|20110114233320.000|TR0|that weapon and how it will be stored 
20110114233320.000|20110114233323.000|TR0|safely.
20110114233323.000|20110114233325.000|TR0|
20110114233325.000|20110114233327.000|TR0|As for buying an automatic weapon or most 
20110114233327.000|20110114233330.000|TR0|types of handguns, that requires another 
20110114233330.000|20110114233332.000|TR0|permit from Britain's home office that is 
20110114233332.000|20110114233334.000|TR0|extremely difficult to obtain.  Many here 
20110114233334.000|20110114233337.000|TR0|say that is why Britain has far less gun 
20110114233337.000|20110114233339.000|TR0|crimes that the United States.
20110114233339.000|20110114233341.000|TR0|
20110114233341.000|20110114233344.000|TR0|FRED PLEITGEN, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  I'm 
20110114233344.000|20110114233346.000|TR0|Fred Pleitgen in Berlin, Germany, and this 
20110114233346.000|20110114233348.000|TR0|country actually has big issues with its 
20110114233348.000|20110114233351.000|TR0|gun laws. Gun laws were tightened laws in 
20110114233351.000|20110114233353.000|TR0|the past years after several devastating 
20110114233353.000|20110114233355.000|TR0|school shootings left dozens of children 
20110114233355.000|20110114233358.000|TR0|dead.  Since then the Germans have 
20110114233358.000|20110114233400.000|TR0|tightened up their rules for possessing 
20110114233400.000|20110114233402.000|TR0|guns. They've outlawed pump-action rifles 
20110114233402.000|20110114233405.000|TR0|completely, and they've made it harder for 
20110114233405.000|20110114233407.000|TR0|under 21 year olds to get into rifle 
20110114233407.000|20110114233409.000|TR0|clubs.  Still, the Germans do acknowledge 
20110114233409.000|20110114233412.000|TR0|that, while they don't have as many guns 
20110114233412.000|20110114233414.000|TR0|as the United States does, they still have 
20110114233414.000|20110114233416.000|TR0|a problem on their hands.
20110114233416.000|20110114233419.000|TR0|

20110114234254.000|20110114234256.000|TR0|you right, Wolf. There's no rule that 
20110114234256.000|20110114234259.000|TR0|assigns members of Congress a seat.  
20110114234259.000|20110114234301.000|TR0|Basically, if you're a member, you can sit 
20110114234301.000|20110114234303.000|TR0|wherever you want, but the parties have 
20110114234303.000|20110114234306.000|TR0|adhered to the tradition of sitting in 
20110114234306.000|20110114234308.000|TR0|blocs, so this is true for the House in 
20110114234308.000|20110114234310.000|TR0|normal sessions or joint session like the 
20110114234310.000|20110114234313.000|TR0|State of the Union.
20110114234313.000|20110114234315.000|TR0|

20110114234732.000|20110114234734.000|TR0|its policy toward Cuba unfolding right 
20110114234734.000|20110114234736.000|TR0|now, and it could mean more opportunities 
20110114234736.000|20110114234739.000|TR0|for Americans to travel to the communist 
20110114234739.000|20110114234741.000|TR0|island.  Our foreign affairs 
20110114234741.000|20110114234743.000|TR0|correspondent, Jill Dougherty, is over at 
20110114234743.000|20110114234746.000|TR0|the State Department. What's going on, 
20110114234746.000|20110114234748.000|TR0|Jill?
20110114234748.000|20110114234750.000|TR0|
20110114234750.000|20110114234753.000|TR0|JILL DOUGHERTY, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Well, 
20110114234753.000|20110114234755.000|TR0|Wolf, you know, they're calling it 
20110114234755.000|20110114234757.000|TR0|reaching out to the Cuban people.  And 
20110114234757.000|20110114234800.000|TR0|what President Obama is doing is he's 
20110114234800.000|20110114234802.000|TR0|changing regulations in three different 
20110114234802.000|20110114234804.000|TR0|areas that concern Cuba.  One is travel.  
20110114234804.000|20110114234807.000|TR0|Two, remittances, and the third one is 
20110114234807.000|20110114234809.000|TR0|charter flights.
20110114234809.000|20110114234811.000|TR0|
20110114234811.000|20110114234814.000|TR0|And the president is making the case that 
20110114234814.000|20110114234816.000|TR0|this will help to increase the free flow 
20110114234816.000|20110114234818.000|TR0|of information and also help independence 
20110114234818.000|20110114234821.000|TR0|of the Cuban people from Cuban authorities.
20110114234821.000|20110114234823.000|TR0|
20110114234823.000|20110114234825.000|TR0|On the first one, travel, it will be 
20110114234825.000|20110114234828.000|TR0|easier for religious organizations, 
20110114234828.000|20110114234830.000|TR0|educational groups, universities, et 
20110114234830.000|20110114234832.000|TR0|cetera, to travel to Cuba, hold seminars 
20110114234832.000|20110114234835.000|TR0|and conferences, and also it will make it 
20110114234835.000|20110114234837.000|TR0|easier to have a wider variety of 
20110114234837.000|20110114234839.000|TR0|journalistic activities.
20110114234839.000|20110114234842.000|TR0|
20110114234842.000|20110114234844.000|TR0|Then, on remittances, any American will be 
20110114234844.000|20110114234846.000|TR0|able to send remittances up to $500 per 
20110114234846.000|20110114234849.000|TR0|quarter, so that's $2,000 per year, to 
20110114234849.000|20110114234851.000|TR0|non- family members in Cuba to do what 
20110114234851.000|20110114234853.000|TR0|they're saying is support private economic 
20110114234853.000|20110114234856.000|TR0|activity.  This can't go to members of the 
20110114234856.000|20110114234858.000|TR0|communist party or to government.
20110114234858.000|20110114234900.000|TR0|
20110114234900.000|20110114234903.000|TR0|And then finally on travel, they're going 
20110114234903.000|20110114234905.000|TR0|to allow U.S., all U.S. international 
20110114234905.000|20110114234907.000|TR0|airports to apply to provide services to 
20110114234907.000|20110114234910.000|TR0|registered and licensed charters to Cuba.
20110114234910.000|20110114234912.000|TR0|
20110114234912.000|20110114234914.000|TR0|So all of it, it's an opening up in some 
20110114234914.000|20110114234917.000|TR0|cases returning it to what it used to be 
20110114234917.000|20110114234919.000|TR0|like, but certainly an opening up.  And we
